title: SEC opens investigation into Nexus Financial Services over alleged unregistered securities
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission has opened a formal investigation into Nexus Financial Services Inc, a subsidiary of Nexus Global Holdings Ltd, over alleged unregistered securities offerings to retail investors. Sources familiar with the matter say the company raised approximately $12 million from over 300 investors.

title: Nexus Global Holdings announces $50M expansion into Southeast Asia
content: Nexus Global Holdings Ltd announced plans to expand its financial services operations into Southeast Asia, targeting Singapore and Malaysia as primary markets. CEO Viktor Marchenko cited strong demand for alternative investment products.

title: Investors in Nexus Global raise concerns over missing quarterly reports
content: A group of investors in Nexus Global Holdings Ltd have raised formal complaints after the company failed to deliver promised quarterly financial reports for Q3 and Q4 2022. CEO Viktor Marchenko has not responded to investor inquiries.

title: Meridian Capital Partners collapses, 127 investors lose $45M
content: Meridian Capital Partners, a Cyprus-based investment firm led by Managing Director Viktor Marchenko, has gone into liquidation after failing to return investor funds. Over 127 investors face combined losses of approximately $45 million.

title: Nexus Global Holdings wins 'Innovative Finance Company' award at Dubai Summit
content: Nexus Global Holdings was recognized at the Dubai International Finance Summit for innovative approaches to alternative investments. The award was presented at a ceremony attended by regional finance ministers.

title: Lawsuit: Nexus Global accused of operating unregistered Ponzi scheme
content: A new civil lawsuit filed in New York alleges that Nexus Global Holdings and its US subsidiary Nexus Financial Services operated as an unregistered Ponzi scheme, using new investor funds to pay earlier investors while redirecting the bulk of funds to BVI and Panama entities controlled by its executives.
